byline.contributor: Gretchen Morgenson and Alexandra Stevenson contributed reporting.

abstract: Valeant Pharmaceuticals shares drop over 50 percent after company releases earnings guidance and warns it may default on some of its debt; company says it now expects 2016 revenue of $11 billion to $11.2 billion, down from previous forecast of $12.5 billion to $12.7 billion.

headline.print_headline: A Warning on Earnings by Valeant Sends Its Shares Into a Tailspin
headline.main: Battered Valeant Stock Drops a Further 50% After Weak Guidance

snippet: The company, which is facing inquiries over its drug-pricing policies, had previously delayed the release of its earnings. Its shares dropped sharply.
